meanings.definition: A small folding case for carrying paper money, credit cards, and identification cards.
meanings.sent1: I keep my money and cards in my billfold.
meanings.sent2: She pulled out her billfold to pay for the groceries.
meanings.sent3: The billfold was so full, it almost burst open!
meanings.sent4: His billfold was a treasure trove of memories and cash.
meanings.sent5: The shiny billfold gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To fold a bill or bills.
meanings.sent1: I billfolded the dollar neatly and put it in my pocket.
meanings.sent2: He quickly billfolds the money before putting it in the drawer.
meanings.sent3: She billfolded the bill into a tiny square for safekeeping.
meanings.sent4: The magician seemed to billfold the bill into thin air!
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, he billfolded the note with precision.
